content.text:
Mr. McCONNELL. Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the 
Senate completes its business today, it adjourn until 9:30 a.m. on 
Thursday, November 16; further, that following the prayer and pledge, 
the morning hour be deemed expired, the Journal of proceedings be 
approved to date, the time for the two leaders be reserved for their 
use later in the day, and morning business be closed; finally, that 
following leader remarks, the Senate proceed to executive session and 
resume consideration of the Otting nomination.
content.speaker: Mr. McCONNELL

content.text:
The PRESIDING OFFICER. Is there objection?
  Without objection, it is so ordered.
content.speaker: The PRESIDING OFFICER
